page.title: 11Brecknock Museum contd.
page.content: The ground floor has a welcoming foyer with a modern bookshop leading to an excellent Natural History display which is very popular with children. The lower floor has a traditional Welsh kitchen, a Blacksmiths shop and many farm implements. Up stairs the archaeology gallery shows the progress of man from the stone ages onwards, and has Christain and Roman stone Monuments and of course the Llangorse Canoe. Also intact from 1840 is the Victorian courtroom. The top floor houses a four poster bed, selpt on by Charles the 1'st when he came to Brecon in 1645, many costumes, Welsh Porcelain and a fine collection of Old Welsh Lovespoons. The museum attracts people from all over the world who love to see how people lived in Brecon many years ago.
